title: Cognitive Space gets $1.2 million  U.S. Air Force contract extension for satellite-tasking software
summary: Cognitive Space won a $1.2 million contract extension to continue development of the company’s satellite tasking software for the Air Force Research Laboratory.

title: NASA will leave its $4.1 billion rocket outside as Nicole approaches Florida
summary: "The team reviewed the forecast and determined the rocket will remain at the pad."

title: Virgin Orbit says U.K launch licensing taking longer than expected
summary: Virgin Orbit acknowledged it has taken longer than planned to get approvals for its first launch from the United Kingdom but still expects to conduct the mission before the end of the year.

title: Safran buys Syrlinks space-based radio frequency business
summary: French aerospace giant Safran said Nov. 4 it is extending its ground communications expertise to space by acquiring Syrlinks, which manufactures satellite radio-frequency equipment.

title: NASA Updates Coverage of JPSS-2 Weather Satellite, LOFTID Tech Demo
summary: NASA will provide coverage of the upcoming prelaunch and launch activities for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s (NOAA’s) Joint Polar Satellite System-2 (JPSS-2) mission and NASA’s Low-Earth Orbit Flight Test of an Inflatable Decelerator (LOFTID) technology demonstration.
